title: Sell Brora Whisky
metaTitle: Sell Brora Whisky | Annual Releases & Rare Malts | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: Sell your Brora whisky. We buy Brora 30 Year Old Annual Releases, Rare Malts Selections, and independent bottlings from this Highlanders legend.
heroSubhead: Direct buyer for Brora Annual Releases and rare 1972/1976 vintages.
introParagraph: Brora closed in 1983 alongside Port Ellen. Known for its waxy, farmyard, lightly peated profile, it is a cult favorite among connoisseurs.
photoChecklist: Front label showing Vintage and Age
conditionFactors: Rare Malts Fill: The Rare Malts series often has fill level issues. Neck is best.
Box: Annual releases have specific stoppers and boxes. Completeness matters.
Labels: Brora labels are generally robust, but check for scuffs.
Capsule: Verify the foil is tight and unspun.
pricingFactors: Vintage: 1972 is the legendary Brora vintage. 1976 is also prized.
Release: The 1st Annual Release (2002) commands a premium.
Series: Rare Malts Selection bottles (cask strength) are highly liquid assets.
Bottler: Official bottlings are safest, but top-tier Indies sell well.

faqs.question: What is the 'Rare Malts Selection'?
faqs.answer: A defining series in the 90s/00s. Brora released in this series (white label, map of Scotland) is excellent.

faqs.question: Is Brora peated?
faqs.answer: Yes, older Brora (early 70s) is quite peaty. Later Brora is more waxy. Both are valuable.

faqs.question: Do you buy Brora 30 Year?
faqs.answer: Yes, all releases of the 30 Year Old.

faqs.question: What if I lost the box?
faqs.answer: We deduct a small percentage (usually 5-10%) for missing packaging on high-end bottles.

faqs.question: Do you buy Clynelish?
faqs.answer: Yes, Clynelish is Brora's sister distillery. We buy older Clynelish bottlings.

faqs.question: How fast can I get paid?
faqs.answer: We typically pay within 24 hours of verifying the bottle.
